026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators;
027
028import java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock;
029import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
030
031import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
032import com.ibm.streams.operator.StreamingInput;
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.Tuple;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.model.PrimitiveOperator;
035
036/**
037 * OrderedPortSequencer extends PortSequencer to provide
038 * submission of tuples within a port ordered by the portSequence
039 * attribute.
040 */
041@PrimitiveOperator(description=
042            "Operator that maintains an per-input port `int64` sequence number for arriving tuples and sets it as the `portSequence` attribute of the output tuple and ensures tuples are submitted to its output port is sequence number order.",
043        comment=OrderedPortSequencer.IBM_Teracloud_ApS_COPYRIGHT)
044public class OrderedPortSequencer extends PortSequencer {
045    
046    /**
047     * Array of locks, one per port. Note this object's access
048     * is synchronized using this to guarantee visibility across threads.
049     */
050    private Lock[] portLocks;
051    
052    /**
053     * Create a Lock object for each input/output port (remember the
054     * class assumes a 1-1 mapping between input and output ports).
055     * The lock is a "fair" lock to try and ensure the oldest waiting
056     * thread is granted access first.
057     */
058    @Override
059    public synchronized void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
060        super.initialize(context);
061        portLocks = new Lock[context.getNumberOfStreamingInputs()];
062        for (int p = 0; p < portLocks.length; p++)
063            portLocks[p] = new ReentrantLock(true);
064    }
065    
066    /**
067     * Get the lock for a specific port. Method is synchronized
068     * to guarantee visibility of the array and its contents.
069     * @return Lock object for the port.
070     */
071    private synchronized Lock getPortLock(int port) {
072        return portLocks[port];
073    }
074    
075    /**
076     * Process the tuple and submit it holding the port specific
077     * lock for the entire processing of the tuple. This means
078     * the assignment of the portSequence attribute and submission
079     * of the tuple are in the same critical section, leading
080     * to the order of submission matching the portSequence.
081     */
082    @Override
083    public void process(StreamingInput<Tuple> port, Tuple tuple) throws Exception {
084        
085        final Lock portLock = getPortLock(port.getPortNumber());
086        
087        try {
088             portLock.lock();
089             super.process(port, tuple);
090        } finally {
091            // Ensure the lock is always released by calling the unlock
092            // in a finally block.
093            portLock.unlock();
094        }
095    }
096
097
098}
